title: my Dear coUntess
author: Danny Snelson
keywords: hypertext; appropriated; video; color-coded; algorithm; pataphysics; failure; surrealism
short_description: A dadaist hypervideo that recomposes Alfred Jarry's letter word-by-word using color-coded video fragments. Each word links to source material

title: Not_A_Number (NAN)
author: Xavier Leton (collaboration with Jean-Pierre Balpe
column9: collaborative, political, public art, hypertext, animation, sound, immigration
column10: A series of collaborative digital art projects and hypertext works designed for public spaces and online distribution. The works combine poetry generators
column12: and video to explore themes of revolution

title: Retratos vivos de mamá (1.0)
author: carolina lópez jiménez
keywords: mourning, grief, autobiographical, women creators, hypertext, multimedia, Colombian
short_description: A profound web-based literary project exploring grief and memory after the loss of the author's mother. Combines visceral writing with video
column10: and photography to trace absence and enable mourning through creation.

title: Piksel Zdrój
author: Mariusz Pisarski, Olaf Keller, and 6+ co-authors
keywords: collaborative, Polish, hypertext, detective fiction, netprov, multi-author, experimental
short_description: A major Polish collaborative hypertext novel created by 8+ authors. Consists of 16 interconnected stories (250 lexias
language: 1300+ links) about an unsolved crime at a seaside resort
column9: where the victim was chosen by readers. A landmark experiment in collective digital storytelling.

title: Living Will
author: Mark C. Marino
keywords: postcolonial, interactive fiction, colonialism, resource extraction, coltan, game mechanics, source code, procedural rhetoric
short_description: An interactive fiction where you play as an heir to a coltan magnate. Critiques colonialism and resource extraction through game mechanics (real coltan prices) and a narrative hidden in the source code. A work of "procedural rhetoric" about greed and legacy.

title: The Warp and Weft of Memory
author: Renée Turner
keywords: archive, memory, feminism, clothing, biography, Dutch artist
short_description: A hypertext database exploring the life of artist Gisèle d'Ailly through her wardrobe. Combines photos
column10: and essays to create an intimate feminist portrait via material culture and personal artifacts.

title: The Deserters
author: Laura Okkema
keywords: autobiography, memory, family history, WWII, archives, Twine, Germany, refugee experience
short_description: An autobiographical Twine game exploring three generations of women in the author's German family. Players piece together archival documents
column9: and drawings to uncover stories of war

title: c-ya-laterrrr
author: Dan Hett
keywords: autobiography, serious game, hypertext, loss, Manchester bombing, grief, minimalism, choice-based
short_description: A minimalist, deeply personal Twine game based on the author's experience of losing his brother in the 2017 Manchester Arena bombing. Explores trauma, guilt, and the "what-ifs" of choice through a stark, text-centered branching narrative.

title: The Gathering Cloud
author: J. R. Carpenter
keywords: environment, cloud storage, materiality, poetry, GIF collage, media theory, climate, print/digital hybrid
short_description: A hybrid digital and print work critiquing the environmental impact of "cloud" storage. Combines appropriated GIFs, poetic text, and scientific fragments in a hypertext collage that bridges weather metaphors and digital infrastructure.

title: A kiss is just a kiss
author: Dan Waber
keywords: love, memory, poetry, hypertext novel, slice-of-life, Twine, biography, minimalist
language: poetic hypertext love letter written in Twine. Explores memory
column10: and connection through elliptical fragments and branching pathways
column11: starting from a single kiss. Considered one of the largest Twine projects.

title: TheWorldIsNotDoneYet
author: Annie Grosshans
keywords: memoir, feminism, hypertext essay, literacy, digital remediation, multivoiced, subjectivity, preservation
language: multimodal hypertext essay-memoir exploring print literacy
column10: and feminist subjectivity. Combines personal narrative
column12: and audio to reimagine storytelling and inherited knowledge structures.

title: break .dance
author: Marisa Parham
keywords: Black digital humanities, diaspora, critical theory, hypertext, performance, mash-up, Lemonade, time, slavery
short_description: An experimental digital scholarly work exploring Black diasporic aesthetics, time, and memory. A hypertext mash-up analyzing Beyoncé's "Lemonade," Toni Morrison, and digital culture through text, video, and interactive elements.

title: The Data Souls
author: David Thomas Henry Wright
keywords: data materiality, speculative fiction, generative text, digital archeology, future artifact, data visualization, quantification critique
short_description: A speculative work presented as a future archeological discovery of seven data storage devices from our present. It uses real-world datasets to generate poetic "text performances" and explores data as a fragile, enigmatic cultural artifact.

title: Oldschool Dungeon Crawler GameBook Generator
author: Delacannon
language: playable dungeon-crawler gamebooks (à la Fighting Fantasy) in the browser. Produces maps
column10: and branching narratives through procedural algorithms for each new session.

title: Quauhnáhuac
author: Leonardo Aranda Brito
keywords: Latin American, city, memory, colonialism, Under the Volcano, photo collage
short_description: A locative hypertext that digitally remediates Malcolm Lowry's novel Under the Volcano. Layers historical photos
column9: and sound onto a map of Cuernavaca to explore colonial urban transformation and indigenous memory.
